children: A 30-year-old man is evaluated for recurrent inflammatory eye disease, oral ulcers, and painful scrotal findings, as
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

The most likely diagnosis is Behçet syndrome, characterized by recurrent, painful aphthous oral ulcers and at least two of the following features: recurrent genital ulcers, inflammatory eye disease, cutaneous lesions, or positive findings on a pathergy test (development of an erythematous papular or pustular lesion >2 mm occurring within 48 hours after skin prick by a needle).
